result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell D Lappen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threatens Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant's probation revoked - sentenced to county jail/hoc on 11-30-17; unpaid court obligations of $1,229 and supervision fees of $260
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Defendant Mitchell D Lappen in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing recommendations agreed. Atty Riek requested a delayed report date. State had no objection if its within 1 week of today. Court sentenced the defendant on Ct. 4 to serve 6 months in jail with Huber for work and treatment, Ct. 3 30 days jail, with Huber for work and treatment, concurrent to Ct. 4, Ct. 2 30 days jail, with Huber for work and treatment, concurrent to Cts. 3 & 4. 78 days jail credit. A civil judgment will be entered for all unpaid financial obligations. Jail report date 12/7/17 at 7:00 pm. 3:38/3:59

Defendant Mitchell D Lappen in court with attorney Richard G. Davis.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to Cts. 2,3, & 4.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Ct. 1 Dismissed but read in.  Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 2 years on Cts. 2,3, & 4.  Conditions of probation include:  Submit DNA sample.  No contact with K.K.  Complete domestic abuse counseling.  Ct. 2 $543.00 costs, Ct. 3 $343.00 costs, and Ct. 4 $343.00 costs.  6 month review in court.  3 days credit.

Court called 8:27am. Defendant, Mitchell D Lappen, appeared. Petition is reviewed. Court finds def indigent but the defendant must pay $500 in 10 days and then $200 per month starting August 1st, 2015, if money is not paid then he will not be represented. Court appoints Richard Davis. Court date remains the same. Court adjourned 8:32 am.
